intro: Satureja rodriguezii, commonly known as Rodriguez's savory, is a perennial herb native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their fragrant leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of purple or pink flowers. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
